import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.ba1d27e0:
# ein einfacher Graph
from random import random

x = np.arange(10)
y = np.array([2*i + 3*random() for i in x])

plt.plot(x,y)
plt.show()
source.b136dc2d:
# Scatter- plot
x = np.arange(10)
y = np.array([2*i + 3*random() for i in x])

plt.scatter(x,y)
plt.show()

plt.bar(x,y)
plt.show()

from random import normalvariate

x = np.array([normalvariate(7,1) for i in range(100)])

plt.hist(x)
plt.show()

source.e71e6bf1:
# Lösung

femalemanagers = data.femalesmanagers
malemanagers = data.malemanagers

plt.plot(years, femalemanagers, color = "r", label="Manager (f)")
plt.plot(years, malemanagers, color= "b", label="Manager (m)")

plt.title("durchschnittlischer Stundenlohn pro Jahr")
plt.xlabel("Jahre")
plt.ylabel("Durschnittlicher Stundenlohn (USD)")
plt.legend()

plt.show()

plt.title("durchschnittlischer Stundenlohn pro Jahr")

    labels[labels.index(x)] = x.replace("person", "", 1)
    x = x.replace("person", "", 1)
    labels[labels.index(x)] = x.replace("and", "\n")
    x = x.replace("and", "\n")
    labels[labels.index(x)] = x.title()

source.008f87a3:
diff = [np.array(data[m]) - np.array(data[f]) for f, m in zip(females, males)]
summe = [np.array(data[m]) + np.array(data[f]) for f, m in zip(females, males)]

diff = np.array(diff)
summe = np.array(summe)
